required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SVF Therapy for Human Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Autologous Stromal Vascular Fraction Therapy for Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to asses the safety and efficacy of SVF for treatment of knee osteoarthritis, and establish a novel method to provide 3D MRI imaging for human knee cartilage to qualitatively and quantitatively evaluate cartilage regeneration.

detailed_description.textblock: Study participants voluntarily provided written informed consent to participate in the study. The two knees of each patient were randomly assigned to autologous SVF treatment group or non-treatment control group. The patients were evaluated every 4 weeks for safety and efficacy of autologous SVF therapy for 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiologic evaluation of knee articular cartilage Volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline articular cartilage Volume at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The Volume (cubic millimeter) of knee articular cartilage are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiologic evaluation of knee articular cartilage Volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline articular cartilage Volume at 24 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The Volume (cubic millimeter) of knee articular cartilage are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiologic evaluation of knee articular cartilage Area
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline articular cartilage Area at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The Area (square millimeter) of knee articular cartilage are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiologic evaluation of knee articular cartilage Area
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline articular cartilage Area at 24 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The Area (square millimeter) of knee articular cartilage are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiologic evaluation of knee articular cartilage Thickness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline articular cartilage Thickness at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The Thickness (millimeter) of knee articular cartilage are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiologic evaluation of knee articular cartilage Thickness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline articular cartilage Thickness at 24 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The Thickness (millimeter) of knee articular cartilage are measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Knee pain evaluation and functional evaluation (the Western Ontario and McMaster University arthritis index [WOMAC])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline WOMAC arthritis index score at 12 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Knee pain and functional mobility were assessed using WOMAC arthritis index patient questionnaire including 24 parameters for pain, stiffness and physical function. The values ranging from 0 (minimum) to 240 (maximum) and the lower scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Knee pain evaluation and functional evaluation (the Western Ontario and McMaster University arthritis index [WOMAC])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline WOMAC arthritis index score at 24 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Knee pain and functional mobility were assessed using WOMAC arthritis index patient questionnaire including 24 parameters for pain, stiffness and physical function. The values ranging from 0 (minimum) to 240 (maximum) and the lower scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Knee pain evaluation and functional evaluation (The Lysholm Knee Scoring Scale)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Lysholm Knee Scale score at 12 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The Lysholm Knee Scoring Scale questionnaire has been designed to evaluate how patients' knee pain has affected their ability to manage everyday life. The values ranging from 0 (minimum) to 100 (maximum) and the higher scores mean a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Knee pain evaluation and functional evaluation (The Lysholm Knee Scale)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Lysholm Knee Scale score at 24 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The Lysholm Knee Scoring Scale questionnaire has been designed to evaluate how patients' knee pain has affected their ability to manage everyday life. The values ranging from 0 (minimum) to 100 (maximum) and the higher scores mean a better outcome.

arm_group.description: Three milliliter of cell suspension injection containing 1.0E8 SVF cells into the knee joint

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Knee Osteoarthritis
- Articular cartilage defect grades I/II of both knee
Exclusion Criteria:
- autoimmune or inflammatory arthritis
- serious medical disorders

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected IPD, all IPD that underlie results in a publication
